name: Dream Island Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We celebrated our honeymoon at the Dream Island Hotel in Sept of this year and couldn’t have been happier with the choice. I completely agree with others that the hosts made us feel part of the family for the duration of our stay. The hotel is situated 5 minutes walk from the centre of town close to the shopping, cable car and restaurants with the sunset view. The pool is a highlight with excellent sunlight until late afternoon and an array of beds, couches and hammocks. Breakfast offers a good selection and Wifi was available throughout.
reviews.title: Highly recommended family run hotel

reviews.text: Tips from the trip:-
reviews.title: Vacation to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Explore the island. Wait until 11am and any cars still available for rent drop to half price. (Peugeot 207 cabriolet- 60 Euros ) You can see the whole island in half a day. We loved the ancient ruins, it’s a tricky drive getting there but worth it and the 2 hours exploring the site offers excellent photo opportunities.
reviews.title: Great Locations, Lovely rooms, mediocre breakfast!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Sunset boat trip- Spiridakos tour booked through through the hotel was stunning. Lovely views of the island and volcano, great BBQ, swimming at the hot springs and free flowing local wine.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, but no Caldera views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Donkey Ride- Plenty of negative reviews on here but we really enjoyed it
reviews.title: Its all true! from skeptic to advocate in 2 days...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had two excellent nights at this lovely hotel in Fira. We arrived on Easter Sunday before noon via SuperJet from Crete, and were promptly invited to join the family and staff for an Easter BBQ celebration. We naturally accepted and had a wonderful time with the hotel family and other guests like ourselves, with delicious food, music, dancing and cheery celebrations. The hotel is incredibly clean, beautiful and has lovely views to the east all the way to the sea. The rooms wrap around a lovely plaza area with a nice pool. Our room had a lovely balcony where we could sit and also where we could dry the clothes we chose to wash by hand. There is also a laundry located nearby in case you'd prefer someone else do your washing. It's a convenient walk to the center of the village, the bus station, and the shopping district on the rim of the caldera. We did not rent a vehicle, choosing instead to walk and use the perfectly adequate bus system. Via bus we toured to the black sand beach of Perissa all then all the way to Oia and back with no trouble. Breakfasts here are very nice. Of course the family and staff here at the hotel are absolutely marvelous. Completely helpful and full of great suggestions for how to get about and where to go. They also offer complimentary pickup service to/from the boat harbor and the airport. Just let them know when you need pickup / dropoff and they will take care of you. We booked directly with the hotel after checking here and at their web site. Oh, and the business center with free use of two computers and the lobby area are very nice indeed, and we used the business center to make several arrangments for the rest of our trip to Greece. Free wi-fi if you choose to use it for your own devices, as we also did. Wi-fi signal is best in the lobby or on your balcony.
reviews.title: Outstanding family-operated hotel, lovely views, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed staying in Fira and at this hotel during Easter 2011. It is a family run business and this shows in the top quality service provided. The family invited all the guests to a BBQ on Easter Sunday which is a tradition for greeks. The hotel is close to the town centre and market street - about 5 minutes walk and a few minutes more to the bus station. We did not hire a car and relied on the buses which was fine. The rooms are very spacious and tastefully decorated and there is free wireless throughout the hotel (also a business centre you can use for free if you don't have a device with you). The breakfast served between 8 - 10 was good quality and fitted us up for hours. The pool is not really big enough for swimming lengths but it is big enough for a number of people to relax in undisturbed by kids playing down one end. If you tell the hotel when your flights/ferries are they will pick you up and drop you off for free. Thira was a lovely island and this hotel (despite the slightly cheesy name) was excellence would definitely return and stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Why stay anywhere else - they have it all and deliver the best service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has been nearly a year since I stayed at the Dream Island Hotel, but it is still a fresh memory. We greatly enjoyed the hospitality and the quality of the accomadations. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was a nice touch. It was nice to be so close to the shops and the restaurants. If you plan to stay in Santorini for more than a few days, I do recommend staying here and staying at a hotel on the caldera side. We decided to do that because we wanted to be able to see the sunset and the sunrise. If we ever make it back to this beautiful island we will do the same thing and stay at the Dream Island Hotel.
reviews.title: Still dreaming about dream island

reviews.text: We found the Greek people to be the friendliest we've ever met, and our hostess, Georgia, and everyone at else Dream Island, to be the best of the best. When we left, we felt like we were leaving dear friends. They were accomodating above and beyond the call, even managing to schedule a tour to the volcano during the offseason, when no one had started running them yet. Santorini itself is a great destination and one we would highly recommend. Very relaxing, yet plenty to do.
reviews.title: Quite simply a great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on the quiet side of Fira town. It's 3 min walk to the center of Fira.
reviews.title: Great Location.
So pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: When we first arrived to the Dream Island hotel we were dissapointed that it was not on the water. Some of the pictures from the website looked like it was located right on the shore. After we got settled, the room and the owners made us feel so welcome that we forgot that. Every question or request we had was addressed by them. The rooms had so many little touches that you knew a lot of pride went into the accomodations. I would recommend Dream Island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although it has a sea view rather than caldera view, this hotel's multi-tiered layout and gorgeous color design provides a stunning setting all its own. We stayed here for three days and thoroughly enjoyed it. There's a 5 minute walk to the main square along Fira's busy main drag, but the hotel is tucked down-hill behind the road-facing buildings so it is very quiet and peaceful. (Everything in Fira involves going up and down pretty steep slopes so people with trouble walking should be cautious about coming here.) Nice pool, free internet, good breakfast in a "cave" room; every room has its own balcony or patio area. Highlight was the personable service from the proprietor, Georgia, and her family.
reviews.title: Beautiful design, quiet location, delightful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just left the Dream Island Hotel and Santorini a few days ago and had to brag on it before I got busy and returned to the real world. They hotel itself is very nice and a great value for the accomodations and location (just steps away from all the restaurants, shops and bars of Firs). But the level of customer service provided by the owner and her family is what truly differentiates this hotel from others. Included in your room rate is transportation to and from the hotel on your arrival/departure. Our ferry to Crete was delayed because of labor strikes and she was the first one to tell us and she knew exactly when we needed to be at the port. We were even able to use the pool after check out while we were waiting around. Also, the family has a dog that hangs out at the hotel. I was sitting in one of the beatiful canopies around the pool enjoying a drink before dinner and it just jumped up in the seat next to me. You really are made to feel like you are an invited guest in their home rather than just another traveler. We will definitely be returning for another visit.
reviews.title: What a fantastic hotel!!

reviews.text: we travelled with children and their grandmother, we had a suite on the second floor which had a lovely view and very spacious, my mother had a double room which she was very comfortable with, family run business very friendly and accommodated anything we asked for including drinks from the bar to our room in the evening, the kids loved the pool and the breakfast was very nice, the kids loved the puppy dog named 'athena' also very friendly, our ship was delayed on arrival and the owners followed up and on our arrival they were there to collect our luggage which was a 4 hour delay, would stay again good value for money a short walk to the city.
reviews.title: great for the family

reviews.text: We stayed here with friends (and their young child) for 3 nights. The rooms were lovely, little bungalows all set out around the pool area. The rooms were large, clean and well set out. The pool area had sun lounges and an undercover area with lounge couches with cushions - perfect for relaxing all day long! Great service, and the location is perfect for walking into the main part of Fira, while still being super quiet and secluded. Breakfast was ok, in a room underneath the building without a view or windows which was a shame, but still fine. Perhaps slightly overpriced, but still a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great pool and location

reviews.text: The whole package at Dream Island is just right. It is in a quiet peaceful location but just a short walk from the main town. This is the fourth time we have been here and we will keep coming. Georgia and her family are the perfect hosts who can't do enough for you. They will help you with places to visit, any drinks, or just for a chat. They certainly have hospitality off to a fine art which would shame larger hotels. The hotel is small, intimate but always immaculately presented and clean. Whilst we were there there was a staff member painting the roofs which looked like they had just been painted! Go there, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights last week and thought it was in a great location, only five minutes walk from the centre of town and the caldera. Many of the hotels do not show their correct location on maps and claim to be closer to the centre than they are - this one is truly close to the centre. And yet it is quiet, relaxing with a great view (not of the caldera, but the other side of the island) The rooms are pretty new and very clean, but as a single traveller I thought that my room, though very comfortable, was a bit on the small side. Other rooms are much bigger. But the pool is lovely and breakfast very ample. I enjoyed my stay here and will definitely stop at the Dream Island on my next visit to Santorini next year.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel in Fira

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Real nice owners.The hotel is very well kept,nice spot ( were all the action & view are),big rooms and just the right size of pool and lot with 20 rooms only.Included,we were treated a very generous breakfast in the oldest win cave on the island...magic !
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel on two occasions. It is not on the caldera side but has an amanzing view of the other side of the island. We have two children and we liked that you could walk into Fira in about five minutes.
reviews.title: Love the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a studio which had a separate bedroom and the kids shared a pullout sofa bed in the lounge room. It was clean and spacious and adequate for what we needed. It also had a nice balcony with table and chairs.
reviews.title: Great pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights and had an excellent holiday, from the owner picking us up from the airport to the time we checked out the staff were exceptionally friendly and willing to help with anything.
reviews.title: Friendly family run hotel - highly recommended

reviews.text: The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the centre of Fira and the local villages of Firostefani and Inmeroviglio are a nice walk away.
reviews.title: Outstanding visit

reviews.text: The hotel is small however it's really well looked after, the rooms are spotless and considering the main road through Fira is on your doorstep it's really peaceful and quiet.
reviews.title: DReam Location

reviews.text: We absolutely loved our time here and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to stay in Santorini.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel

reviews.text: Any good hotel helps you feel like a valued guest, but a great hotel goes out of their way to help you feel like one of the family - and Dream Island is a great hotel! We appreciated the on-time pickup at the ferry and the warm greeting on arrival; the owners answered our many questions about what to see on Santorini, where to eat, etc. Breakfast was fine with plenty to choose from and freshly prepared dishes. Rooms are clean and comfortable with personal touches and open onto a beautiful courtyard overlooking the city and the sea. The temperatures in early April kept the pool (and sea!) quite cold but everything was very clean and well-maintained.
reviews.title: Exceptional family-run hotel - can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: This hotel is run by a very nice family and is very clean and darling. The staff is really nice and very helpful. The hotel is walking distance to Fira and luckily off the main road that is extremely busy. They steered us in the right direction for great food. The shopping is not great...lots of cheesy jewelry shops, rude store owners and tons of cruisers.
reviews.title: Darling, Family-Run Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were not impressed by Dream Island Hotel. It was very average and I expected more for the money. The room and bathroom were just ok and I felt they could have been a bit cleaner and the breakfast was sparse. We preferred Oia over Fira after our first day. We cut our 3 night stay to 2 nights at Dream Island and moved over to Oia for our last night.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: When we originally booked this hotel, I was a bit worried about the hotel being on the non-Caldera side. We didn't need to worry as this hotel was the best of any other we passed on the Caldera side. The pool was huge and very welcoming after a long day sightseeing. We would have been lost without it. It is about a five minute walk up to watch the sunset and there are lots of little bars and restaurants that have a magnificent view of the sunset to sit at anyway. The room was lovely and spacious. Comfy beds and a great bathroom. There was even a clothes line, much to my mum's delight! The breakfast was delicious and a huge variety to choose from. The staff are so friendly and welcoming and we enjoyed the free cherry water we received when we arrived after our flight. There is free internet in the lobby area. The hotel has been beautifully decorated and the atmosphere is very relaxing. Overall, I'm so glad we chose to stay here instead of the Caldera side. Everything you need is a short walk away, and this hotel was calm and peaceful. If we ever return to Santorini, we would stay here again in a heartbeat! Oh, and we also love Athina the 'watchdog' of the hotel!
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else!

reviews.text: We recently traveled to Santorini with two little ones, and had a great stay at the Dream Island. The owner and his wife spoke excellent English, and were very friendly and helpful in a genuine way. We felt very welcome. The free car service to and from the airport was reliable, and very convenient!
reviews.title: Great hotel, would gladly recommend it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a great location, outside of the rather dumpy Fira town center (on the main drag), but close enough to easily walk, and far off the road so that it is quiet. Good car rental outfit across the street. Lovely pool, with a view of the sea in the distance (not on caldera, though). Our room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The maid service was top notch. Great balcony overlooking the stylish pool. Only negative was very weak water pressure in the shower.
reviews.title: Fantastic Pool, great value, and a clothes line!

reviews.text: We have just returned from Dream Island after 11 nights. We are returning again in September. The hotel continues to be very clean and with a great quiet atmosphere. We continue to love it particularly as there is no music around the pool so it is so peaceful. Georgia, her husband and family cannot do enough for you. They are very lovely people and really helpful. Please go there as you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Fantastic as always!

reviews.text: Dream Island was absolutely great. The owners are at the desk everyday and they're the sweetest people will find. My husband had a sinus infection and since it was a Sunday, we were having a hard time finding an open drugstore, but the owners gave him medicine from their own so he could have some relief until Monday. The pick up and drop off service is great! The rooms are wonderful and you have a feeling of being a home. The pool are is amazing! Very relaxing! And the location is wonderful. Walking distance to the city center, bus station and taxi stand. I would stay here over and over again.
reviews.title: I wanted to stay

reviews.text: We were a group of 3 families, 10 people in all. We had 5 rooms and they were all very clean and well decorated. They were even roomy based on European standards! The owners were very attentive and helpful, the breakfasts were above average and the hotel is well located. It's about a 3 minute walk to the center of Fira. Far enough away to be away from the noise but within easy access. We rented a car one day and spent about 8 hours exploring the island, this island is an easy island to drive, not too much traffic in May and not too difficult to find your way around. For the dog lovers, you will be greeted by the owners dog Athena, a very friendly ball of fur! We all highly recommend this hotel we know you will enjoy your stay.
reviews.title: Family owned hotel run with pride of ownership, extremely friendly!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an amazing time in Santorini and loved our stay at the Dream Island Hotel. There were 16 of us there to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday. Georgia and her family were wonderful and made us feel very special. The pool area is lovely. It's only a short walk to the town centre. The Dream Island is excellent value for money. I wrote about our adventure recently in an Australian online publication:
reviews.title: A great place for a celebration

reviews.text: http://www.wangle.com.au/life/celebrating-milestones-in-style
reviews.title: The best hotel Ive ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I happened upon Dream Island the day we arrived in Greece. We walked into a travel agency and booked the first ferry out along with the hotel special they had that day. We felt SO lucky to have ended up at Dream Island. The hotel is newly built and beautifully decorated by the wife/mother of the family. The father and daughter were waiting for us at the ferry terminal to take us there and even offered a ride to take us back the day we left. We ended up reserving an extra night we were so pleased. Breakfast is available each morning and it is quite the buffet spread. We got to have our scrambled eggs and sausage we missed from the US. There are not very many rooms so there is not too much noise and sometimes you feel that you have the place to yourself. I would visit this place again in a heartbeat. It is a little on the spendy side, but if you are looking for comfort, peaceful, clean and safe and don't mind spending this much I would absolutely recommend staying here!
reviews.title: Gorgeous, clean, amazing English speaking family run resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from Dream Island Hotel and I want to share this great experience. The hotel has a fantastic location (very near to the centre town but in a quiet street), the services at the hotel are very good (swimming pool, free transfer to the airport, breakfast..), but the best thing it's the exceptional attention from the family who lead the hotel. They are lovely and the make you feel like at home.Thank you for everything and I hope you like the wine.
reviews.title: Great location and excelent atention!!

reviews.text: What can one say when the owners personally pick you up and deliver you to the port or airport? It certainly was appreciated given that the port of Santorini is not that welcoming nor does the steep and winding roads look particularly appealing on a bus either.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm on a beautiful island

reviews.text: The Dream Hotel is certainly unique. Given that it is a family run hotel, it has that extra special feel to it whereby personal attention is taken for granted. However, it did at times feel surreal with the family dog running around the place with a bucket around its head and the little boy playing with battery operated toy airplane in the pool area...
reviews.title: The Most Hospitable Hotel Ever

reviews.text: Still, one cannot fault the place. The rooms are clean, modern and attention to detail has been given to all aspects of the room, although the painted window took a little getting used to. Time on the balconies were nice to spend the end of the day after a day of leisure out and about. The breakfast was delightful and Fira town is only a 5 minute stroll away, including the bus station too. The pool area has a very relaxing feel to it with a lovely view of the Aegean sea, and is blessed with sunshine all afternoon, even till around 6PM, when the focus then becomes the sunset overlooking the caldera...The family are lovely and are always there for you.. even checking out and paying for the room did not seem an issue.. it seems to flow with the relaxed feel of living on a beautiful island.
reviews.title: High quality hotel with great service!

description: This "dreamy" hotel was built in 2006 according to the best requirements and specifications for you, since our aim is your best stay on our island all year long. We provide transport to and from the harbour and the airport. Our services include daily room cleaning, laundry, internet, safe box, mini bar, hair dryers, television, telephone, air-conditioning and best of all dreamy holidays and exceptional experiences for our guests.
